original: Hallander, Hans Olof Håkan, cen-traldLSpenisäriläkare, Linköping, f. 15/7/ 01 i Lerbäck, Örebro k, aiv disp. Ivar H. o. Tora Andræ. G. 31 m. Signe Ehinger. Barn: Gunilla f. 32, Hans-Oilof 36. — Stud:ex. i Linköp. 19, med. kand. i Upps. 23, med. lic. i Sthlm 28. Assist :läk. o. tf. andre und:läk. v. Linköp. las. med. avd. 27-29, andre und:läk. där 29-30, förste dito 30-33, undiläk. v. Spenishults sanat. 33-34, v. Söderby .sjukh. 34-38, läk. v. centr:-di;sp. i Linköp. sed. 38, iläk. v. Stra-tomta bygdesanat. sed. 42. Skr.: arb. i inv. med. o. tuberk. RFinlLO, Finl-RK förtj:BM.
translated: Hallander, Hans Olof Håkan, central district chief physician, Linköping, born on July 15th, 1901 in Lerbäck, Örebro county. His parents were Ivar H. and Tora Andræ. He married Signe Ehinger in 1931 and they had two children: Gunilla (born in 1932) and Hans-Olof (born in 1936). He completed his secondary school education in Linköping in 1919, received a Bachelor of Medicine degree from Uppsala University in 1923, and a medical license from Stockholm in 1928. He worked as an assistant physician and temporary deputy physician at the medical department of Linköping Hospital from 1927 to 1933, first as a temporary deputy and then as a deputy. He worked as an assistant physician at Spenishults sanatorium from 1933 to 1934 and at Söderby Hospital from 1934 to 1938. He became a physician at the central district hospital in Linköping in 1938 and at Stratomta rural sanatorium in 1942. He has written articles on internal medicine and tuberculosis and has been awarded the Finnish Order of the Lion and the Swedish Royal Order of Merit.

structured.name: Hans Olof Håkan Hallander
structured.description: Hans Olof Håkan Hallander was a central district chief physician in Linköping and an expert in internal medicine and tuberculosis. He was born in Lerbäck, Örebro county on July 15th, 1901 to Ivar H. Hallander and Tora Andræ. He married Signe Ehinger in 1931 and they had two children: Gunilla and Hans-Olof.
